search.query: index=covid Country_Region="$country$" Province_State!="*, *" | fields Province_State | dedup Province_State | sort Province_State

index=covid Country_Region="$country$" Province_State!="*, *" | fields Province_State | dedup Province_State | sort Province_State
index=covid Country_Region="$country$" Province_State!="*, *" | fields Province_State | dedup Province_State | sort Province_State

index=covid Country_Region="$country$" Province_State!="*, *" | fields Province_State | dedup Province_State | sort Province_State
index=covid Country_Region="$country$" Province_State!="*, *" | fields Province_State | dedup Province_State | sort Province_State
index=covid Province_State="$state1$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state2$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state3$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state4$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state5$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state6$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid Province_State="$state7$" | fields Admin2 | dedup Admin2 | sort Admin2
index=covid | fields Country_Region | dedup Country_Region | sort Country_Region

index="covid" host="covid-19" | dedup source | fields source
`comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval time=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10)
| sort time | stats last(time) AS last_time
| table last_time
| makeresults | eval title="STATE REPORTS"

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state2$")
`comment("Fix Last_Update field name when it has a space")` | rename "Last Update" AS temp_last_update | fields source,Last_Update,temp_last_update
| eval Last_Update=coalesce(Last_Update,temp_last_update)
`comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10)
`comment("This is important for the timechart to present the fixed results")` | eval day_last_update=substr(Last_Update, 1, 10) | eval day_last_update=if(day_last_update="3/22/20 23","2020-03-22",day_last_update) `comment("fix 3/22/20 Last_Update string")`
| eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval day_last_update_epoch=strptime(day_last_update,"%Y-%m-%d")
| eval time=if(day_epoch>=day_last_update_epoch,day_epoch,day_last_update_epoch) `comment("get most recent date that the data was updated")`
| stats latest(time) AS time
| eval time = strftime(time, "%F")

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state2$")

| eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval day_last_update_epoch=strptime(day_last_update,"%Y-%m-%d")
| eval time=if(day_epoch>=day_last_update_epoch,day_epoch,day_last_update_epoch) `comment("get most recent date that the data was updated")`
| stats latest(time) AS time
| eval time = strftime(time, "%F")

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state1$")
`comment("| fields _time,Confirmed,Deaths,FIPS,Recovered,State,County,source,Last_Update")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")` `comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")` | dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch
| timechart sum(Confirmed) AS Confirmed by State

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state2$")

| timechart sum(Confirmed) AS Confirmed by State

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state7$")
`comment("| fields _time,Confirmed,Deaths,FIPS,Recovered,State,County,source,Last_Update")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")` `comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")` | dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch
| timechart eval(sum(Deaths)/sum(Confirmed)*100) AS "Death Rate" by State
| makeresults | eval title="COUNTY REPORTS"

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state1$" AND Admin2="$county1$")
`comment("Fix Last_Update field name when it has a space")` | rename "Last Update" AS temp_last_update | fields source,Last_Update,temp_last_update
| eval Last_Update=coalesce(Last_Update,temp_last_update)
`comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10)
`comment("This is important for the timechart to present the fixed results")` | eval day_last_update=substr(Last_Update, 1, 10) | eval day_last_update=if(day_last_update="3/22/20 23","2020-03-22",day_last_update) `comment("fix 3/22/20 Last_Update string")`
| eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval day_last_update_epoch=strptime(day_last_update,"%Y-%m-%d")
| eval time=if(day_epoch>=day_last_update_epoch,day_epoch,day_last_update_epoch) `comment("get most recent date that the data was updated")`
| stats latest(time) AS time
| eval time = strftime(time, "%F")

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state2$" AND Admin2="$county2$")

`comment("This is important for the timechart to present the fixed results")` | eval day_last_update=substr(Last_Update, 1, 10) | eval day_last_update=if(day_last_update="3/22/20 23","2020-03-22",day_last_update) `comment("fix 3/22/20 Last_Update string")`
| eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval day_last_update_epoch=strptime(day_last_update,"%Y-%m-%d")
| eval time=if(day_epoch>=day_last_update_epoch,day_epoch,day_last_update_epoch) `comment("get most recent date that the data was updated")`
| stats latest(time) AS time
| eval time = strftime(time, "%F")

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state1$" AND Admin2="$county1$")
`comment("| fields _time,Confirmed,Deaths,FIPS,Recovered,State,County,source,Last_Update")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")` `comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")` | dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch | eval County=County." County (".State.")"
| timechart sum(Confirmed) AS Confirmed by County

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state6$" AND Admin2="$county6$")
`comment("| fields _time,Confirmed,Deaths,FIPS,Recovered,State,County,source,Last_Update")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")` `comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")` | dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch | eval County=County." County (".State.")"
| timechart eval(sum(Deaths)/sum(Confirmed)*100) AS "Death Rate" by County

index="covid" host="covid-19" (Province_State="$state7$" AND Admin2="$county7$")
`comment("| fields _time,Confirmed,Deaths,FIPS,Recovered,State,County,source,Last_Update")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")` `comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")` | dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch | eval County=County." County (".State.")"
| timechart eval(sum(Deaths)/sum(Confirmed)*100) AS "Death Rate" by County
